title: Temperature model version comparison
text:
Introduction
The EcoHSEDS temperature model gets updated approximately annually as new data are submitted to the database. Each update produces a new version. Here we examine changes in predictions between version 1.3 (Sept 2021) and version 1.4 (Jan 2024).
In addition to all the catchments, we focus on 2 areas with significant increases in data between versions, the Neversink in NY and the Potomac in Virginia.

title: 1  Get data
text:
1.1 Combine versions


Code
d13 <- d13 |> mutate(ver = 3)
d14 <- d14 |> mutate(ver = 4)

d <- bind_rows(d13, d14) |> 
  left_join(catchHucs, by = c("featureid" = "catchment_id"))

title: 2  All rivers
text:
2.1 Mean July temperature


Code
plotAll(dWide, "mean_jul_temp_3", "mean_jul_temp_4","huc6")





Code
plotByHUC(dWide, "mean_jul_temp_3", "mean_jul_temp_4", "huc6")

title: 2  All rivers
text:
2.2 Mean August temperature


Code
plotAll(dWide, "mean_aug_temp_3", "mean_aug_temp_4","huc6")





Code
